1.text: My son, keep my words and treasure my commandments within you.

2.text: Keep my commandments and live; guard my teachings as the apple of your eye.

3.text: Tie them to your fingers; write them on the tablet of your heart.

4.text: Say to wisdom, “You are my sister,” and call understanding your kinsman,

5.text: that they may keep you from the adulteress, from the stranger with seductive words.

6.text: For at the window of my house I looked through the lattice.

7.text: I saw among the simple, I noticed among the youths, a young man lacking judgment,

8.text: crossing the street near her corner, strolling down the road to her house,

9.text: at twilight, as the day was fading into the dark of the night.

10.text: Then a woman came out to meet him, with the attire of a harlot and cunning of heart.

11.text: She is loud and defiant; her feet do not remain at home.

12.text: Now in the street, now in the squares, she lurks at every corner.

13.text: She seizes him and kisses him; she brazenly says to him:

14.text: “I have made my peace offerings; today I have paid my vows.

15.text: So I came out to meet you; I sought you, and I have found you.

16.text: I have decked my bed with coverings, with colored linen from Egypt.

17.text: I have perfumed my bed with myrrh, with aloes, and with cinnamon.

18.text: Come, let us take our fill of love till morning. Let us delight in loving caresses!

19.text: For my husband is not at home; he has gone on a long journey.

20.text: He took with him a bag of money and will not return till the moon is full.”

21.text: With her great persuasion she entices him; with her flattering lips she lures him.

22.text: He follows her on impulse, like an ox going to the slaughter, like a deer bounding into a trap,

23.text: until an arrow pierces his liver, like a bird darting into a snare—not knowing it will cost him his life.

24.text: Now, my sons, listen to me, and attend to the words of my mouth.

25.text: Do not let your heart turn aside to her ways; do not stray into her paths.

26.text: For she has brought many down to death; her slain are many in number.

27.text: Her house is the road to Sheol, descending to the chambers of death.
